sen.j: 百々 綱家（どど つないえ、天文 (元号)17年（1548年）? - 慶長14年（1609年））は、戦国時代 (日本)から江戸時代の武将。
sen.e: Tsunaie DODO (1548 (uncertain)-1609) was Busho (a Japanese military commander) in the period ranging from the Sengoku Period (Japan) to the Edo Period.
Tsunaie DODO (1548 (uncertain)-1609) was Busho (a Japanese military commander) in the period ranging from the Sengoku Period (Japan) to the Edo Period.
Tsunaie DODO (c. 1548 - 1609) was a military commander in the period ranging from the period of warring states to the Edo period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 織田信長、秀信に仕え、関ヶ原の戦い後に山内一豊に招聘された人物である。
sen.e: He served for Nobunaga ODA and Hidenobu ODA and was invited by Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI after the battle of Sekigahara was over.
He served for Nobunaga ODA and Hidenobu ODA and was invited by Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI after the battle of Sekigahara was over.
He served for Nobunaga ODA and Hidenobu ODA and was invited by Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI after the battle of Sekigahara was over.

sen.j: 諱は安信、安行とも。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) was Yasunobu and Yasuyuki.
His imina (personal name) was Yasunobu and Yasuyuki.
His personal name was Yasunobu and Yasuyuki.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 官職名は越前守。
sen.e: The name of his job grade was Echizen no kuni no kami (the governor of Echizen Province.)
The name of his job grade was Echizen no kuni no kami (the governor of Echizen Province.)
The name of his official title was the governor of Echizen Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 野戦、築城術に通じていた。
sen.e: He was familiar with the techniques of open battle and the erection of a castle.
He was familiar with the techniques of open battle and the erection of a castle.
He was familiar with the techniques of open battle and the construction of a castle.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 宇多源氏、近江京極氏。
sen.e: The Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan) and the Omi-Kyogoku clan.
The Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan) and the Omi-Kyogoku clan.
The Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan) and the Omi-Kyogoku clan.

sen.j: 京極秀綱の弟。
sen.e: A younger brother of Hidetsuna KYOGOKU.
A younger brother of Hidetsuna KYOGOKU.
He was a younger brother of Hidetsuna KYOGOKU.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 源綱家。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tsunaie
MINAMOTO no Tsunaie
MINAMOTO no Tsunaie

sen.j: 近江国犬上郡百々村に居を構え、百々殿と呼ばれる。
sen.e: He had a house in Dodo Village, Inukami Country, Omi Province and was called Dodo dono (殿.)
He had a house in Dodo Village, Inukami Country, Omi Province and was called Dodo dono (殿.)
He had a house in Dodo Village, Inukami Country, Omi Province, so he was called Dodo dono (Master Dodo).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天文17年（1548年）生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in 1548.
He was born in 1548.
He was born in 1548.

sen.j: 浅井氏に属する佐和山城の城代・百々盛実（盛道）は一族か（天文15年（1546年）生まれとも）。
sen.e: Morizane (Morimichi) DODO (may have been born in 1546), head of Sawayama Castle who belonged to the Asai clan may have been from the same family.
Morizane (Morimichi) DODO (may have been born in 1546), head of Sawayama Castle who belonged to the Asai clan may have been from the same family.
Morizane (Morimichi) DODO, who was the keeper of Sawayama-jo Castle and belonged to the Asai clan, may have been from the same family (there is a theory that Tsunaie may have been born in 1546).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 当時、近江守護職の家柄である京極氏は家督争いが原因で衰退していたため、家臣筋である近江・浅井氏に属していた。
sen.e: At that time, the Kyogoku clan who continued to serve in the post of Omi no kami shugoshoku (Provincial Constable of Omi Province) was weak because of succession disputes, and he belonged to the Asai clan in Omi who was in the line of their vassal.

At that time, the Kyogoku clan who continued to serve in the post of Omi no kami shugoshoku (Provincial Constable of Omi Province) had weakened due to disputes over succession, and belonged to the Asai clan in Omi which was in the line of their vassal.

At that time, as the Kyogoku clan, who continued to serve in the position of the Provincial Constable of Omi Province, had weakened due to disputes over succession, he belonged to the Asai clan in Omi, which was in the line of their vassal.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 元亀元年（1570年）6月の姉川の合戦で浅井長政が織田信長に敗れた後は信長に仕え、中山道と北国街道の分岐点の摺針峠の関所を護る。
sen.e: After Nagamasa ASAI lost the Battle of Anegawa against Nobunaga ODA in June 1570, he served for Nobunaga and worked to safeguard Sekisho (a checking station) located in Suruhari-toge Pass where Nakasen-do Road and Hokkoku Kaido Road merged.

After Nagamasa ASAI lost the Battle of Anegawa against Nobunaga ODA in June 1570, he served Nobunaga and worked to safeguard Sekisho (a checking station) located in Suruhari-toge Pass where Nakasen-do Road and Hokkoku Kaido Road were merged.

After Nagamasa ASAI lost the Battle of Anegawa against Nobunaga ODA in June 1570, he served Nobunaga and worked to safeguard a barrier located in Suruhari-toge Pass where Nakasen-do Road and Hokkoku Kaido Road were merged.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）、本能寺の変で信長が倒れると、豊臣秀吉の陣に属し、山崎の合戦で軍功を上げる。
sen.e: After Nobunaga was killed in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, he joined the camp of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and performed achievements in the Battle of Yamasaki.
After Nobunaga was killed in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, he joined the camp of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and performed achievements in the Battle of Yamasaki.
After Nobunaga was killed in the Honnoji Incident in 1582, he joined the camp of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and distinguished himself in the Battle of Yamasaki.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その後、秀吉によって岐阜城にいる信長の嫡孫・三法師（当時2歳・後の織田秀信）の後見役を命じられ、岐阜城に入り、後に家老となった。
sen.e: Then, since he was directed by Hideyoshi to act as a guardian for Nobunaga's legitimate grandson Sanboshi (he was two years old at that time and grown to Hidenobu ODA) who was staying in Gifu Castle, he entered the castle, and became a chief retainer afterward.

Then, since he was directed by Hideyoshi to act as a guardian for Nobunaga's legitimate grandson Sanboshi (he was two years old at that time and grown to Hidenobu ODA) who was staying in Gifu Castle, he entered the castle, and became a chief retainer afterward.

Then, since he was directed by Hideyoshi to act as a guardian for Nobunaga's legitimate grandson Sanboshi (he was two years old at that time, staying in Gifu Castle, and grown to Hidenobu ODA), he entered the castle, and became a chief retainer afterward.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: この際代官領と併せ1万1千石を有す。
sen.e: Around that time, he had territories which yielded 11,000 koku in rice including Daikan (a local governor) yields vested to him.
Around that time, he had territories which yielded 11,000 koku in rice including Daikan (a local governor) yields vested to him.
Around that time, he had territories that yielded 11,000 koku in rice including a local governor territory vested to him.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 文禄元年（1592年）、文禄・慶長の役の際には、綱家は12歳になった織田秀信の名代として兵六千を引き連れて朝鮮に渡る。
sen.e: In 1592 when the Bunroku-Keicho War occurred, Tsunaie crossed the ocean to reach Korea, leading six thousand soldiers as a representative of Hidenobu ODA of twelve.
In 1592 when the Bunroku-Keicho War occurred, Tsunaie crossed the ocean to reach Korea, leading six thousand soldiers as a representative of Hidenobu ODA of twelve.
In 1592 when the Bunroku-Keicho War occurred, Tsunaie crossed the ocean to reach Korea, leading six thousand soldiers as a representative of Hidenobu ODA who was twelve years old.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いでは、西軍に与した秀信に対して東軍に与するように諫言したが、聞き入れられることはなかった。
sen.e: In the battle of Sekigahara occurred in 1600, Hidenobu was supporting the West squad, Tsunaie advised him to take the side of the East squad rather than the West squad, but he would not listen to Tsunaie's advice.

In the battle of Sekigahara occurred in 1600, Hidenobu was supporting the West squad, Tsunaie advised him to take the side of the East squad rather than the West squad, but he would not listen to Tsunaie's advice.

In the battle of Sekigahara occurred in 1600, Hidenobu was supporting the West squad; Tsunaie advised him to take the side of the East squad rather than the West squad, but he would not listen to Tsunaie's advice.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 米野の戦いにおいては飯沼長資、津田藤左衛門らとともに二千五百の兵を率いて米野に布陣、奮戦し東軍を苦戦させる働きをするも五倍近い兵力の差から劣勢に陥り後退を余儀なくされる。
sen.e: In the Komeno War, Hidenobu set up a camp in Komeno and fought hard enough to give a tough time to the East squad, directing 25,000 soldiers together with Nagasuke IINUMA and Tozaemon TSUDA, but they were going to lose the war because the enemy had almost five times number of soldiers, and forced to pull back.
sen.cmt: 主語が記載されていないのですが、前後から秀信だろうと考えそのように英訳しました。
sen.e: In the Komeno War, Hidenobu set up a camp in Komeno and fought hard enough to give a tough time to the East squad, directing 25,000 soldiers together with Nagasuke IINUMA and Tozaemon TSUDA, but were forced to pull back as they were threatened with losing the war due to the enemies size being five times their own.

In the Komeno War, Tsunaie set up a camp in Komeno and fought hard enough to give a tough time to the East squad, directing 2500 soldiers together with Nagasuke IINUMA and Tozaemon TSUDA--but were forced to pull back, as they were threatened with losing the war due to the enemies size being five times their own.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: このとき殿を務め見事にやり遂げている。
sen.e: In this incident, he acted as a leader and accomplished remarkable performance.
In this incident, he acted as a leader and left and accomplished record.
In this incident, he served as a leader and left an accomplished record.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その後、岐阜城での籠城を決め込むが、福島正則の言に従い、降伏・開城する。
sen.e: Afterward, he continued holding Gifu Castle, but he surrendered the castle to the enemy in accordance with Masanori FUKUSHIMA's advice.
Afterward, he continued holding Gifu Castle, but he surrendered the castle to the enemy in accordance with Masanori FUKUSHIMA's advice.
Afterward, he determined to hold Gifu-jo Castle, but he surrendered the castle to the enemy in accordance with Masanori FUKUSHIMA's advice.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: この罪で秀信は高野山に流され、綱家は京都で蟄居を命じられる。
sen.e: Because of that sin he was expelled to Mt. Koya, and Tsunaie was ordered to be confined to home in Kyoto.
Because of that sin he was expelled to Mt. Koya, and Tsunaie was ordered to be confined to home in Kyoto.
For punishment, Hidenobu was expelled to Mt. Koya, and Tsunaie was ordered to be placed under house arrest in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦後、しばらくは浪人となった。
sen.e: After the battle of Sekigahara, Tsunaie was Ronin (a masterless samurai) for a while.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the battle of Sekigahara, Tsunaie was Ronin (a masterless samurai) for a while.
After the battle of Sekigahara, Tsunaie led a life of masterless samurai for a while.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 土佐藩主となった山内一豊から家康に「越前守の蟄居を解く」願いが出されて許可されたため、七千石の築城奉行として迎えられた。
sen.e: Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI acting as the head of Tosa Domain sent Ieyasu a request asking 'to relieve Echizen no kuni no kami (governor of Echizen Province) from the confinement' and his request was accepted, and Tsunaie was invited to take the post of Chikujo Bugyo (magistrate of building a castle) in the castle which yielded 7,000 koku in rice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI acting as the head of Tosa Domain sent Ieyasu a request asking 'to relieve Echizen no kuni no kami (governor of Echizen Province) from the confinement' and his request was accepted, and Tsunaie was invited to take the post of Chikujo Bugyo (magistrate of building a castle) in the castle which yielded 7,000 koku in rice.

Kazutoyo YAMANOUCHI acting as the lord of Tosa Domain sent Ieyasu a request asking 'to relieve the governor of Echizen Province from the confinement,' which was accepted, and Tsunaie was invited to take the position of the magistrate of building a castle which yielded 7,000 koku in rice.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: その官職名から、高知城の西に「越前町」が残っている。
sen.e: There exists 'Echizen-cho' in the west of Kochi Castle, succeeding the name of his official post.
The name 'Echizen-cho' in the west of Kochi Castle, still exists, signifying the name of his official post.
The name 'Echizen-cho' in the west of Kochi-jo Castle, still exists, signifying the name of his official position.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 近江国坂本 (大津市)の石工集団「穴太衆（あのうしゅう）」の技術力を駆使し、「河内」という低湿地だった場所に「高知城」を築いたのをはじめ、慶長6年（1601年）には江戸城の石垣の修復などにもはるばると遠征をしている。
sen.e: Tsunaie built 'Kochi Castle' in damp area called 'Kawachi' using the techniques of a masonrygroup 'Anoshu' in Omi Province Sakamoto (Otsu City,) and even made a long trip to Edo Castle to repair the stonewalls in 1601.

Tsunaie built 'Kochi Castle' in a marsh called 'Kawachi' using the techniques of a masonrygroup 'Anoshu' in Omi Province Sakamoto (Otsu City,) and even made a long trip to Edo Castle to repair the stonewalls in 1601.

Tsunaie built 'Kochi-jo Castle' in a marsh called 'Kawachi' using the techniques of a masonry group 'Anoshu' in Sakamoto (Otsu City), Omi Province; and also made a long trip to Edo-jo Castle to repair the stonewalls in 1601.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一豊死後は山内忠義に仕えた。
sen.e: After Kazutoyo died, he served for Tadayoshi YAMANOUCHI.
After Kazutoyo died, he served Tadayoshi YAMANOUCHI.
After Kazutoyo died, he served Tadayoshi YAMANOUCHI.

sen.j: 慶長14年（1609年）、江戸幕府が西国ににらみを効かせるため、松平康重（徳川家康の落胤説がある）の居城として丹波国篠山城の築城をする際、綱家は土佐国高知城築城の総奉行を務めていた途上であったが、兵二千を引き連れて石垣普請に赴く。
sen.e: When Tsunaie was acting as Sobugyo (grand magistrate) for the erection of Kochi Castle in Tosa Province, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) began with the erection of Shinoyama Castle in Tamba Province with an aim to demonstrate their power to Saigoku (the western part of Japan (esp. Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)) and use it as the residing castle of Yasushige MATSUDAIRA (believed Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's illegitimate child,) and Tsunaie left for Tamba Province to assist the construction of the stonewalls, leading 2,000 soldiers.

When Tsunaie was acting as Sobugyo (grand magistrate) for the erection of Kochi Castle in Tosa Province, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) began with the erection of Shinoyama Castle in Tamba Province with an aim to demonstrate their power to Saigoku (the western part of Japan (esp. Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)) and use it as the residing castle of Yasushige MATSUDAIRA (believed Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's illegitimate child). Tsunaie left for Tamba Province to assist the construction of the stonewalls, leading 2,000 soldiers.

In 1609 when Tsunaie was acting as grand magistrate for the construction of Kochi-jo Castle in Tosa Province, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) began with the construction of Shinoyama-jo Castle in Tanba Province with an aim to demonstrate their power to the western part of Japan and use it as the residing castle of Yasushige MATSUDAIRA (believed to be Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's illegitimate child); Tsunaie left for Tanba Province to assist the construction of the stonewalls headed 2,000 soldiers.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし心労が重なり病にたおれ、静養のために京に上るがそこで病死。
sen.e: However, Tsunaie got sick due to strains of worry and was back to Kyoto, and he died of disease.
However, Tsunaie became sick due to stress and returned to Tokyo where he passed away.
However, Tsunaie fell ill due to stresses and returned to Kyoto where he passed away.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: 享年63。
sen.e: He was sixty three years old.
He was sixty three years old.
He was sixty-three years old.
sen.cmt: ハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: なお子孫は、嗣子百々出雲守直安以降代々山内家に仕える。
sen.e: Regarding his offspring, Izumo-no-kami Naoyasu DODO (the governor of Izumo Province) and other heirs of Dodo served for the Yamanouchi family in generations.
Regarding his offspring, Izumo-no-kami Naoyasu DODO (the governor of Izumo Province) and other heirs of Dodo served the Yamanouchi family in generations.
Regarding his offspring, the governor of Izumo Province Naoyasu DODO and the successive heirs of the Dodo family served the Yamanouchi family.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 因みに幕末の土佐藩参政吉田東洋の父、土佐藩馬廻役吉田光四郎正清は、百々家から吉田家へ養子入りした。
sen.e: Koshiro-masakiyo YOSHIDA, father of Toyo YOSHIDA as a politician of Tosa Domain, who took the post of Umamawari (a horse guard,) was a son-in-law of the Yoshida family who had been from the Dodo family.
Koshiro-masakiyo YOSHIDA, father of Toyo YOSHIDA as a politician of Tosa Domain, who took the post of Umamawari (a horse guard,) was a son-in-law of the Yoshida family who was from the Dodo family.
Koshiro-masakiyo YOSHIDA, who was a horse guard of Tosa Domain and the father of Toyo YOSHIDA, a politician of Tosa Domain, was a son-in-law of the Yoshida family from the Dodo family.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に小文字に変更しました。

sen.j: 江戸末期に岡田文圓が表した「新撰美濃誌」には、「岐阜中納言秀信の家臣百々越前守、ここに居りしゆえ、名字を百々と称しけるとぞ」と書かれたりしている。
sen.e: In 'Shinsen-minoshi' written by Bunen OKADA in the late Edo period, there is a statement that 'Dodo Echizen-no-kami, a retainer of Chunagon (associate chief of the councilor of state) Hidenobu was conferred a family name Dodo because you are staying here.'

In 'Shinsen-minoshi' written by Bunen OKADA in the late Edo period, there is a statement that 'Dodo Echizen-no-kami, a retainer of Chunagon (associate chief of the councilor of state) Hidenobu was conferred a family name Dodo because you are staying here.'

In 'Shinsen-minoshi' (Newly Edited Annals of Mino Province) written by Bunen OKADA in the late Edo period, there is a statement that 'Dodo Echizen no kami, a retainer of associate chief of the councilor of state Hidenobu, was conferred a family name Dodo because he stayed here.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また昨今の「地名事典」の中には、岐阜市の最高峰の「百々ヶ峰の名は、越前守の居城があったから」とか書いているのもあるが、「築城の名手」であったことから、そんな話が生まれたのかも知れない。
sen.e: In some of recent 'gazetteers', there is a description about the highest mountain in Gifu City that 'the mountain was given a name Dodogamine because the castle where the governor of Echizen Province used to live existed there,' and such anecdote may have been told from his aspect that 'He is a mater of castle erection.'

In some of recent 'gazetteers', there is a description about the highest mountain in Gifu City that 'the mountain was given a name Dodogamine because the castle where the governor of Echizen Province used to live existed there,' and such anecdote may have been told from his aspect that 'He is a mater of castle erection.'

In some of recent 'gazetteers,' there is a description about the highest mountain in Gifu City that 'the mountain was given a name Dodogamine because the castle where the governor of Echizen Province used to live existed there,' and such episode may have been told from his aspect that 'He is a mater of castle construction.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: また「岐阜城落城後の越前守は行方不明」と書いている事典もあるが、「築城の名手」として高知城・江戸城・篠山城の築城に当たっている。
sen.e: Some of gazetteers tell that 'the governor of Echizen Province is missing after Gifu Castle was surrendered,' but he was involved in the erection of Kochi Castle, Edo Castle and Shinoyama Castle like a mater of castle erection.

Some of gazetteers tell that 'the governor of Echizen Province is missing after Gifu Castle was surrendered,' but he was involved in the erection of Kochi Castle, Edo Castle and Shinoyama Castle like a mater of castle erection.

Some of gazetteers tell 'the governor of Echizen Province is missing after Gifu-jo Castle was surrendered'--but he was involved in the construction of Kochi-jo Castle, Edo-jo Castle and Shinoyama-jo Castle as a 'mater of castle construction.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: そうした技術を持っていたが故に、因みに安土城には百々橋なる橋があった。
sen.e: There is a bridge called Dodo Bridge in the site of Azuchi Castle, that tells that he had such techniques.
There is a bridge called Dodo Bridge in the site of Azuchi Castle, that tells that he had such techniques.
There is a bridge called Dodo-bashi Bridge in the site of Azuchi-jo Castle, which tells that he had the techniques of bridge construction.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

tit.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 城の石垣には、
sen.e: Methods of constructing castle's stonewalls will be the following:
Methods of constructing castle's stonewalls will be the following:
Methods of constructing castle's stonewalls are:
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 自然石をそのまま積む「野面積み」
sen.e: Nomen-zumi': stacking natural stones as is,
Nomen-zumi': stacking natural stones as is,
Nomen-zumi': Stacking natural stones as they are;
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。大文字にしました。

sen.j: 大雑把に加工する「打ち合わせ剥ぎ」
sen.e: Uchiawase-hagi': processing natural stones roughly before stacking, and
Uchiawase-hagi': processing natural stones roughly before stacking, and
Uchiawase-hagi': Cutting natural stones roughly before stacking; and
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。大文字にしました。

sen.j: 完全に整形する「切り込み剥ぎ」
sen.e: Kirikomi-hagi': forming natural stones thoroughly before stacking.
Kirikomi-hagi': forming natural stones thoroughly before stacking.
Kirikomi-hagi': Cutting natural stones thoroughly into shape before stacking.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。大文字にしました。

sen.j: があるというが、比叡山の麓・坂本の「穴太衆（あのうしゅう）」は朝鮮系の渡来人とも言われ、大小の自然石をそのまま使って体裁よりも頑丈さ・水はけの良さでの石組み技術に卓越していた。
sen.e: It is believed that 'Anoshu' who were living in Sakamoto located at the bottom of Mt. Hiei were from Korea and technically excelled at constructing stonewalls for strength and great water drainage rather than for appearance, using various sized natural stones as is.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that 'Anoshu' who were living in Sakamoto located at the bottom of Mt. Hiei were from Korea and technically excelled at constructing stonewalls for strength and great water drainage rather than for appearance, using various sized natural stones as is.

It is believed that 'Anoshu' who were living in Sakamoto located at the bottom of Mt. Hiei were from Korea and technically excelled at constructing stonewalls for strength and great water drainage rather than for appearance, using various sized natural stones as they were.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 6・7世紀の古墳に始まり、延暦寺の石垣や里坊等の石垣・石塔などで技術を磨き、大坂城・聚楽第・伏見城等の石垣構築に当たったが、綱家もこうした職人集団に支えられていたのである。
sen.e: After they polished their techniques through constructing, first, Kofun (tumulus) in the 6th to 7th and then, stonewalls of Enryaku-ji Temple and stonewalls and stone pagodas of Satobo (small village temples,) they got involved in the construction of the stonewalls of Osaka Castle, Jurakudai residence and Fushimi Castle, and it is supposed that Tsunaie got help and assistance from such professional groups.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After they polished their techniques through construction, first, Kofun (tumulus) in the 6th to 7th and then, stonewalls of Enryaku-ji Temple and stonewalls and stone pagodas of Satobo (small village temples,) they got involved in the construction of the stonewalls of Osaka Castle, Jurakudai residence and Fushimi Castle, and it is supposed that Tsunaie got help and assistance from such professional groups.

After they developed their techniques through construction, first, Kofun (tumulus) in the sixth to seventh centuries, and then stonewalls of Enryaku-ji Temple and stonewalls and stone pagodas of small village temples, they got involved in the construction of the stonewalls of Osaka-jo Castle, Jurakudai residence and Fushimi-jo Castle, and it is supposed that Tsunaie got help and assistance from such professional groups.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。不要な記号を削除しました。
